title.value: Flexible Phase Dynamics for Bio-Plausible Contrastive Learning
title.justification: This is the primary title provided on the first page of the paper.
title.quote: Flexible Phase Dynamics for Bio-Plausible Contrastive Learning

extractions.description: The paper investigates alternative training dynamics for contrastive learning (CL) to understand the breadth of systems capable of implementing it. Through theoretical foundations and numerical experiments, it shows that CL can be implemented in biological or neuromorphic systems with temporally local updates, thus relaxing the constraints on training dynamics.

type.justification: The paper is focused on providing theoretical foundations and deriving new gradient estimators with proofs, supported by numerical experiments to demonstrate their feasibility.
type.quote: Thanks to a set of general theorems corroborated by numerical experiments across several CL models, our results provide theoretical foundations for the study and development of CL methods for biological and neuromorphic neural networks.

name.justification: The paper focuses on making contrastive learning algorithms bio-plausible and applicable to both biological and neuromorphic systems.
name.quote: CL has been proposed as a normative model for biological learning (Baldi & Pineda, 1991; Illing et al., 2021; Hinton et al., 1984; Scellier & Bengio, 2017; Cao et al., 2020)...

name.justification: The main focus of the paper is to relax the dynamical constraints on contrastive learning methods.
name.quote: These Contrastive Learning (CL) algorithms are traditionally implemented with rigid, temporally non-local, and periodic learning dynamics...

name.justification: The paper discusses equilibrium-based contrastive learning methods extensively and proposes modifications for them.
name.quote: We restrict our study to the subclass of CL algorithms with a two-term gradient... equilibrium propagation (Scellier & Bengio, 2017), and energy based models optimizing the negative log-likelihood (LeCun et al., 2006)...

name.justification: The Boltzmann Machine is used as an example for equilibrium-based contrastive learning methods in the paper.
name.quote: We restrict our study to the subclass of CL algorithms with a two-term gradient... For example, the Boltzmann machine (Ackley et al., 1985)...
